revised_title: The Misconception of the Lamina Splendens in Articular Cartilage
tldr: The so-called lamina splendens of articular cartilage, a bright line observed under phase contrast microscopy, is an optical artifact caused by phase contrast and diffraction effects. The researchers demonstrated that this bright line appears along the edges of various materials, not just cartilage, and can be explained by Fresnel diffraction when using phase contrast microscopy.
